001package imagingbook.lib.pdf;
002
003import java.awt.Graphics2D;
004import java.awt.color.ColorSpace;
005import java.awt.color.ICC_Profile;
006import java.io.FileNotFoundException;
007import java.io.FileOutputStream;
008import java.io.IOException;
009import java.nio.file.Path;
010
011import com.lowagie.text.BadElementException;
012import com.lowagie.text.Document;
013import com.lowagie.text.DocumentException;
014import com.lowagie.text.Image;
015import com.lowagie.text.Rectangle;
016import com.lowagie.text.pdf.FontMapper;
017import com.lowagie.text.pdf.PdfContentByte;
018import com.lowagie.text.pdf.PdfGraphics2D;
019import com.lowagie.text.pdf.PdfWriter;
020
021import ij.ImagePlus;
022import ij.gui.Overlay;
023import ij.gui.Roi;
024import imagingbook.Info;
025import imagingbook.lib.util.ParameterBundle;
026
027
028/**
029 * Exports an {@link ImagePlus} instance, including its vector overly
030 * (if existent) to a PDF file.
031 * Configuration is accomplished by passing a {@link PdfExporter.Parameters}
032 * instance to the constructor.
033 * If selected, core Type1 fonts are substituted and embedded in the PDF.
034 * 
035 * @author WB
036 * @version 2022/03/15
037 */
038public class PdfExporter {
039
040        private static double MinStrokeWidth = 0.01;            // substitute for zero-width strokes
041
042        private final Parameters params;
043        private final ImagePlus im;
044
045        /**
046         * Parameter bundle for class {@link PdfExporter}.
047         * Annotations are used for inserting the complete parameter bundle in
048         * ImageJ's {@code GenericDialog}.
049         */
050        public static class Parameters implements ParameterBundle {
051
052                @DialogLabel("Author:")
053                public String author = System.getProperty("user.name");
054                @DialogLabel("Title:")
055                public String title = null;
056
057                @DialogLabel("Subject:")
058                public String subject = "";
059
060                @DialogLabel("Keywords:")
061                public String keywords = "";
062
063                @DialogLabel("Include raster image:")
064                public boolean includeImage = true;
065                @DialogLabel("Upscale image:")
066                public boolean upscaleImage = true;
067                @DialogLabel("Upscale factor:")@DialogDigits(0)
068                public int upscaleFactor = 1;
069                @DialogLabel("Add sRGB color profile:")
070                public boolean addIccProfile = true;
071
072                @DialogLabel("Include vector overlay:")
073                public boolean includeOverlay = true;
074                @DialogLabel("Min. stroke width:")@DialogDigits(2)
075                public double minStrokeWidth = MinStrokeWidth;
076                @DialogLabel("Embed core fonts:")
077                public boolean embedCoreFonts = true;
078
079                @DialogLabel("Include image props:")
080                public boolean includeImageProps = true;
081
082                @DialogHide
083                public boolean debug = false;
084                
085                @Override
086                public boolean validate() {
087                        return 
088                        upscaleFactor >= 1 && 
089                        minStrokeWidth >= 0;
090                }
091        }
092
093        // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
094
095        public PdfExporter(ImagePlus im, Parameters params) {
096                this.im = im;
097                this.params = params;
098        }
099
100        public PdfExporter(ImagePlus im) {
101                this(im, new Parameters());
102        }
103
104        // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
105
106        public String exportTo(Path path) {
107                final int width  = im.getWidth();       // original image size
108                final int height = im.getHeight();
109                Overlay overlay = im.getOverlay();      // original overlay (if any)
110
111                // Step 1: create the PDF document
112                Rectangle pageSize = new Rectangle(width, height);
113                
114                try (Document document = new Document(pageSize)) {
115
116                        // Step 2: create a PDF writer
117                        PdfWriter writer = null;
118                        try {
119                                writer = PdfWriter.getInstance(document, new FileOutputStream(path.toFile()));
120                        } catch (DocumentException | FileNotFoundException e) {
121                                if (params.debug) System.out.println("Could no create PdfWriter to path " + path.toString());
122                                return null;
123                        }
124
125                        // Step 3: open the document and set various properties (TODO)
126                        document.open();
127                        document.addTitle(params.title);
128                        document.addAuthor(params.author);
129                        document.addSubject(params.subject);    
130                        document.addKeywords(params.keywords);
131                        document.addCreationDate();                     
132                        document.addCreator("ImageJ Plugin (imagingbook)");
133                        document.addProducer(this.getClass().getName() + " " + Info.getVersionInfo());
134
135                        // Step 4: create a template and the associated Graphics2D context
136                        PdfContentByte cb = writer.getDirectContent();
137
138                        // Step 5: set sRGB default viewing profile
139                        if (params.addIccProfile) {
140                                ICC_Profile colorProfile = ICC_Profile.getInstance(ColorSpace.CS_sRGB);
141                                try {
142                                        writer.setOutputIntents("Custom", null, "http://www.color.org", "sRGB IEC61966-2.1", colorProfile);
143                                } catch (IOException e) { 
144                                        if (params.debug) System.out.println("Could not add ICC profile!");
145                                }
146                                //byte[] iccdata = java.awt.color.ICC_Profile.getInstance(ColorSpace.CS_sRGB).getData();
147                                //com.itextpdf.text.pdf.ICC_Profile icc = com.itextpdf.text.pdf.ICC_Profile.getInstance(iccdata);
148                        }
149
150                        // Step 6: insert the image
151                        if (params.includeImage) {
152                                ImagePlus im2 = this.im;
153                                int upscale = params.upscaleFactor;
154                                if (upscale > 1) {      // upscale the image if needed (without interpolation)
155                                        im2 = im.resize(width * upscale, height * upscale, "none");
156                                }
157                                
158                                try {
159                                        Image pdfImg = com.lowagie.text.Image.getInstance(im2.getImage(), null);
160                                        pdfImg.setAbsolutePosition(0, 0);
161                                        pdfImg.scaleToFit(width, height);       // fit to the original size             
162                                        cb.addImage(pdfImg);
163                                } catch (BadElementException | IOException e) {
164                                        if (params.debug) System.out.println("Could not insert image!");
165                                        return null;
166                                }
167                        }
168
169                        // Step 7: draw the vector overlay
170                        if (overlay != null && params.includeOverlay) {
171                                // https://stackoverflow.com/questions/17667615/how-can-itext-embed-font-used-by-jfreechart-for-chart-title-and-labels?rq=1
172                                Graphics2D g2 = (params.embedCoreFonts) ? 
173                                                new PdfGraphics2D(cb, width, height, new CoreFontMapper(), false, false, 0) : 
174                                                new PdfGraphics2D(cb, width, height); // no core font embedding
175
176                                Roi[] roiArr = overlay.toArray();
177                                for (Roi roi : roiArr) {
178                                        double sw = roi.getStrokeWidth();
179                                        if (sw < params.minStrokeWidth) {       // sometimes stroke width is simply not set (= 0)
180                                                roi.setStrokeWidth(params.minStrokeWidth);      // temporarily change stroke width
181                                        }
182                                        ImagePlus tmpIm = roi.getImage();
183                                        roi.setImage(null);     // trick learned from Wayne to ensure magnification is 1
184                                        roi.drawOverlay(g2);    // replacement (recomm. by Wayne)
185                                        roi.setImage(tmpIm);
186                                        if (sw < 0.001f) {
187                                                roi.setStrokeWidth(sw); // restore original stroke width
188                                        }       
189                                }
190                                g2.dispose();
191                        }
192
193                        // Step 8: copy ImagePlus custom properties to PDF
194                        if (params.includeImageProps) {
195                                String[] props = im.getPropertiesAsArray();
196                                if (props != null) {
197                                        for (int i = 0; i < props.length; i+=2) {
198                                                String key = props[i];
199                                                String val = props[i + 1];
200                                                document.addHeader(key, val);
201                                        }
202                                }
203                        }
204
205                        // Step 9: close PDF document
206                        //document.close();
207                }       // auto-close
208                
209                return path.toAbsolutePath().toString();
210        }
211
212}
